p: Poor neighborhoods, with informal housing, lack of sanitation and presence of vector breeding places are especially suited for Aedes aegypti, the main vector for arboviruses in FG. This urban mosquito preferentially breeds around human dwellings, in outdoor water storage containers and in any recipient containing stagnant rain water. Densely populated areas with sustained human activity during the day are perfect for a daytime feeder that can bite several people in a short period of time [ 3].
